alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 3:38PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Judith Basin. In north central Montana, Chouteau. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen from 230 pm until 330 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area between 330 pm and 430 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Judith Basin and South Central Chouteau Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
